universum.studios.android.support.universi

Class UniversiActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • FragmentActivity
      • universum.studios.android.support.universi.UniversiActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UniversiActivityContext

    public abstract class UniversiActivity
extends FragmentActivity
implements UniversiActivityContext
    An Activity implementation that provides Universi context features via UniversiActivityDelegate including other features described below.

    1) Data binding

    Whether it is used data binding provided by Google to bind application logic and layouts or some custom data binding logic, this activity class provides a simple way to manage data binding requests and to perform actual binding. Whether a new data need to be bound to a view hierarchy of a specific instance of UniversiActivity, requestBindData() need to be called. This method can be invoked from any thread. If data binding request has been registered, UniversiActivity will invoke onBindData() method whenever its view hierarchy is already created or waits until it is created.

    1) Permissions

    This activity class has support for a new permissions management model introduced in the Marshmallow Android version. Permissions related methods like checkSelfPermission(String) or supportRequestPermissions(String[], int) can be invoked regardless of current Android version.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    UniversiCompatActivity, UniversiFragment

      • UniversiActivity

        public UniversiActivity()
        Creates a new instance of UniversiActivity. If annotations processing is enabled via UniversiConfig all annotations supported by this activity class will be processed/obtained here so they can be later used.

                                        @NonNull
                                        <any> callbacks)
        Description copied from interface: UniversiActivityContext
        Starts a loader with the specified id. If there was already started loader with the same id before, such a loader will be re-started, otherwise new loader will be initialized.

        Parameters:

        params - Params for loader.
        callbacks - Callbacks for loader.
        Returns:
        Initialized or re-started loader instance or null if the specified callbacks do not create loader for the specified id.
        See Also:
        #initLoader(int, Bundle, LoaderManager.LoaderCallbacks), #restartLoader(int, Bundle, LoaderManager.LoaderCallbacks), UniversiActivityContext.destroyLoader(int)

      • requestBindData

        protected void requestBindData()
        Requests performing of data binding specific for this activity via onBindData(). If this activity has its view hierarchy already created onBindData() will be invoked immediately, otherwise will wait until onContentChanged() is invoked.

        This method may be invoked also from a background-thread.

      • onBindData

        @UiThread
protected void onBindData()
        Invoked due to call to requestBindData() to perform data binding specific for this activity instance.

        This is always invoked on the UI thread.

      • supportRequestPermissions

        public void supportRequestPermissions(@NonNull
                                      String[] permissions,
                                      int requestCode)
        Invokes #requestPermissions(String[], int) on Android versions above Marshmallow (including).

        Calling this method on Android versions before MARSHMALLOW will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        permissions - The desired set of permissions to request.
        requestCode - Code to identify this request in onRequestPermissionsResult(int, String[], int[]).

      • showXmlDialog

        public boolean showXmlDialog(@XmlRes
                             int resId,
                             @Nullable
                             DialogOptions options)
        Description copied from interface: UniversiActivityContext
        Like UniversiActivityContext.showDialogWithId(int, DialogOptions), but in this case will be used internal instance of DialogXmlFactory to create (inflate) the desired dialog instance to be shown.
        Specified by:
        showXmlDialog in interface UniversiActivityContext
        Parameters:
        resId - Resource id of Xml file containing the desired dialog (its specification) to show.
        options - Options for the dialog.
        Returns:
        True if dialog has been successfully inflated and shown, false if this activity is currently paused or dialog failed to be inflated.
        See Also:
        DialogXmlFactory#createDialog(int, DialogOptions), UniversiActivityContext.dismissXmlDialog(int)

      • dismissXmlDialog

        Specified by:

        Returns:

        See Also:

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()

      • onBackPress

        protected boolean onBackPress()
        Invoked from onBackPressed() to give a chance to this activity instance to consume the back press event before it is delivered to its parent.

        This implementation first tries to dispatch this event to one of its visible fragment via dispatchBackPressToFragments() and if none of the currently visible fragments does not consume the event a stack with fragments will be popped via popFragmentsBackStack().

        Returns:
        True if the back press event has been consumed here, false otherwise.

      • dispatchBackPressToFragments

        protected boolean dispatchBackPressToFragments()
        Dispatches back press event to all currently visible fragments displayed in context of this activity.

        This implementation calls dispatchBackPressToCurrentFragment() and returns its result.

        Returns:
        True if some of the visible fragments has consumed the back press event, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        BackPressWatcher#dispatchBackPress()

      • dispatchBackPressToCurrentFragment

        protected boolean dispatchBackPressToCurrentFragment()
        Dispatches back press event to the current fragment displayed in context of this activity.
        Returns:
        True if the current fragment has consumed the back press event, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        findCurrentFragment(), BackPressWatcher#dispatchBackPress()

      • findCurrentFragment

        @Nullable
protected Fragment findCurrentFragment()
        Finds currently visible fragment that is displayed in context of this activity.

        Note, that implementation of this method assumes that this activity uses FragmentController to display its related fragments and that there may be only one fragment visible at a time, that is in a full screen container.

        Returns:
        Current fragment of this activity (that is at this time visible), or null if there is no fragment presented within fragment container of this activity at all.

      • popFragmentsBackStack

        protected boolean popFragmentsBackStack()
        Pops stack with fragments of this activity.
        Returns:
        True if there was some fragment popped from the stack, false if there were no fragments to pop from.

      • onPause

        protected void onPause()

      • finishWithNavigationalTransition

        public boolean finishWithNavigationalTransition()
        Description copied from interface: UniversiActivityContext
        Finishes this activity with navigational transition specified via UniversiActivityContext.setNavigationalTransition(BaseNavigationalTransition) (if any).
        Specified by:
        finishWithNavigationalTransition in interface UniversiActivityContext
        Returns:
        True if the transition has been used to finish this activity, false if standard framework method (either Activity.finish() or Activity.finishAfterTransition()), depending on the current API level, has been used.
